entries.text: Duke Energy's official customer service pages provide account and support guidance as a primary contact surface.
Duke Energy maintains a separate outages surface for outage reporting, outage maps, and restoration updates.
Duke Energy's account and support tools are spread across customer service and outage pages rather than one guided support thread.
Billing and payment support is handled through customer service/account support paths distinct from outage workflows.
JD Power's 2025 U.S. Utility Digital Experience Study reports that many utility websites/apps fail basic standards and customers encounter digital dead ends.
JD Power's 2025 Electric Utility Residential Customer Satisfaction Study highlights pressure on utilities to improve communication and digital service experiences.

current_strengths: Official customer service and outage pages
Dedicated outage tools and status surfaces
Clear public account support entry points
current_gaps_observed_or_likely: Outage, billing, and service requests remain split across separate support surfaces
No public evidence of one-thread support continuity across channels
No public guided outage/billing resolution layer that keeps context and next steps in one conversation
No public customer-visible tracker for support conversations and follow-ups
